I wrote this article earlier, please don't sleep on it!

It's been a busy day for me with my product Creator OS. My new engagement strategy in the last 24 hours has been working magic now I don't have enough time to handle the notification and engagement. So I slow down to finish the product MVP. If you see this, just reply with your niche and I'll sought you out in my For You feed.

So I slow down to finish the product MVP. If you see this, just reply with your niche and I'll sought you out in my For You feed.

All my metrics were red yesterday because I had to work on my product.

So I applied my Creator OS Product tactics manually and was able to lift it in the past 12 hours but of course the stubborn ER is leaping slowly.

I need 210 verified users to push me to the next milestone, if I can get 200 verified in the last 48 hours, I trust that you guys can do it for me in the next 24 hours.

I am now a thread moderator so if you normally have post that attract 100 replies in the first 1 hour, invite me to help you moderate the conversation in your replies section. The topics must be AI or Creator growth related.

ğŸ”„ Moderator Summary Post â€” Starlink Discussion

*â€œStarlinkâ€™s Super Bowl spotlight has sparked a wide range of reactions â€” from excitement about global coverage to frustration over pricing, regional availability, and product positioning. This isnâ€™t just a product debate. Whatâ€™s emerging is a deeper conversation about *access, expectations, and what connectivity means in different parts of the world.â€

Key themes in the replies so far:

ğŸ”¹ Access vs Expectations:
Some users celebrate Starlink as transformative where traditional internet doesnâ€™t reach, while others point out it doesnâ€™t yet meet expectations in challenging terrain or pricing in developed markets.

ğŸ”¹ Global Perspective:
Interest ranges from questions about availability in countries like India to comparisons with local ISPs â€” highlighting that â€œaffordabilityâ€ isnâ€™t a universal concept.

ğŸ”¹ Future vs Present Tradeoffs:
Discussions about satellite congestion, convergence with cellular, and using infrastructure for off-Earth logistics show that people are thinking beyond the product itself.

ğŸ”¹ Real vs Hype:
Supporters cheer its potential impact, while critics see mismatch between broad ads (like the Super Bowl) and niche early-stage utility.

â€œWeâ€™re at an interesting stage where models are 1000Ã— faster at coding but 10Ã— slower than us at simple web browsing.â€ â€” @snowmaker

Across the thread people are pointing out that:
â€¢ APIs / curl feel fast but UI interpretation drags,
â€¢ Agents still struggle with intent + browsing latency,
â€¢ Multi-agent coordination and CUA are emerging as next frontiers,
â€¢ And even experienced users are surprised how humbling current UX feels.

So hereâ€™s the real question for builders + users:
 Is the bottleneck fundamental (models + perception), or is it just the wrong abstraction layer?

Pick one:
ğŸ”¹ Solve perception first â†’ everything else speeds up
ğŸ”¹ Fix the abstraction layer â†’ browsers become obsolete
ğŸ”¹ Or merge both â†’ thatâ€™s the true breakthrough
Which path do you think actually leads to agents feeling as fast as humans? ğŸ‘‡
